title: Damage prevented stat?
body: Hey Riot, so as a support main, I would find it really interesting as to how my shields and other supportive spells benefit the team in a game. While it's really cool to see how much damage I did as a full support Janna or Lulu, I would much rather see a stat along the lines of damage shielded or damage prevented. Can this be a thing in the near future? Thank you!

replies.body:
Also: Movement Speed impaired. 
Would show how much Movement you impair. Stuns would show the amount of Movement Speed the target had while stunned for the duration they were stunned, e.g. 400 Movement Speed at 1.25 second stun equals 500 at the end game stats. 20% Slow at 400 Movement Speed for 1.5 seconds equals 120 at the end game stats.

almost every champion  can cause movement speed impairedness and with items it becomes every champion. Its also way to much infomation and couldn't be catalogued correctly.
almost every champion can cause damage and with items it becomes every champion. Its also way to much information and couldn't be catalogued correctly.

I think theres a difference. For damage, there are 3 distinct types - Physical, Magic, and True. 1 point of damage is always 1 point of damage. 

A stun doesnt always mean they would be running the entire time. They could be stutter stepping. They could be rooted for animations. As for slows, some champions get wreaked by them, as their "walk" is their only movement ability. Does Kassadin take the same amount from a slow as Darius? Cause if Kassadin is slowed, he can riftwalk to travel faster than walking. Same with LB. 

Then there are little considerations: 
1. Does canceling a homeguard give you bonus movement speed reduction? 
2. How about when CC or slows are improperly chained? (so 2 cc on the same target that overlap in duration.) Do both get it? One? Neither? Split? And if its split, how does it split? Does the slow get the same amount of "movement speed imparied" as the stun? Does a root get the same as a stun? 
3. How do knockbacks work? Do you calculate the length of the of the knockback or the distance it went?

 If the "movement speed impaired" number automatically defaults to "maximum potential for movement speed impaired", then it might not be as useful. I mean, how much use is a "potential damage" stat? 

_____________________________________________
Its harder to calculate a stat that has a range of effectiveness from knockback>knockup>supression>stun>charm>fear>entangle>polymorph>root>slow than damage, where 1 point of damage is always 1 point of damage.
In fact it doesn't get catalogued correctly seen any of the death recaps lately?

Damage Prevented is a little too broad. If it was "Damaged Shielded", then we'd be on to something. Armor and Magic Resist already passively reduce damage, so the numbers would be crazy-high for everybody in a medium-length match. Damaged SHIELDED, on the other hand, is perfect for what you're describing: a stat that shows just how much damage we've prevented with champions like Janna and Lulu (also Face of the Mountain exists).

Still, upvote because I agree with the idea.
With the new Shen coming out this could be an interesting stat

Not a good idea unless it was for magic dmg only there a few items that can gives ok mr but not enough too counter the burst unless you count banshees veil but that is only good for one spell and can be easily destroyed by any mage with 20%cdr
This isn't suggesting that items prevent damage, it's suggesting that the charts shown during the results screen show how much damage was prevented by any one champion.
